body_html: @ajtulloch Yes, that's correct. x86 cpus. I'm associating ARM with mobile and somehow that then turned into "not CPU". There's also something to be said about wanting to split ARM and x86 into two separate categories (of course they can still share), because you'd probably want the aten library to be very small for mobile things. We can do something as in this PR. But that can probably also be done at a CMake level.
body_text: @ajtulloch Yes, that's correct. x86 cpus. I'm associating ARM with mobile and somehow that then turned into "not CPU". There's also something to be said about wanting to split ARM and x86 into two separate categories (of course they can still share), because you'd probably want the aten library to be very small for mobile things. body: @ajtulloch Yes, that's correct. x86 cpus. I'm associating ARM with mobile and somehow that then turned into "not CPU". There's also something to be said about wanting to split ARM and x86 into two separate categories (of course they can still share), because you'd probably want the aten library to be very small for mobile things. We can do something as in [this PR](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7275/files). But that can probably also be done at a CMake level.
